intro: Thysanocarpus rigidus, commonly known as the rigid thysanocarp, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many species in the Malvaceae family. Thysanocarpus rigidus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
